Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	In this manner, O sons, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its completion it will be understood, and by its expositions, and by its declarations, it is to me apparent that I should commit it to you as a treatise on surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since the art of surgery is in our region and in our time greatly neglected, thus bringing great peril to the science of it and the instruments of it are lost; only a few small descriptions remain in the books of the ancients, which have become obsolete and led to errors and superstition until its intentions and meanings are veiled and its power and art elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is apparent to me that I shall revive the order of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and because it will come with the forms of the cautery instruments and the other tools of the work along with the addition of the explanation, and preparation of them, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why no good craftsman is found with his art in this our time, is because the art of medicine is long and that its practitioner must first be exercised in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the members and their forms, as well as their connection and separation; and have understanding of bones, nerves and ligaments, and their numbers, and their growth; and of pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the sites of their emergence.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason it is said by Hippocrates that a name is nothing, but in the work small and particularly in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said of this in the introduction of this book; since whoever is not knowledgeable about anatomy will not be excused if he falls into error, and thus men will die from it, as I have seen many times, because others are misinformed about this science and deny it and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Since I saw a foolish and experienced doctor incise an abscess of the neck on a woman's collarbone, and cut some arteries in the neck so that much blood flowed out before the woman died among her family.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who believed that he could extract a stone from a man who was in pain, and the stone was large, and it came to him and extracted the stone with a piece of the bladder, causing the man to die on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called for it to be pulled out, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, it was clear that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and went to a blacksmith who was in debt to him due to a fracture in his hip; and the ignorant doctor prepared him by extracting the fracture through the wound with tendons and spikes with strong construction, but did not leave space for breathing.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And loosen according to his wishes, and lay him flat, and allow him to lie still for several days and command that we release him from the bindings; and remain in this state until the thigh and leg are abscessed, and it leads to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, prepared to release the bindings, and achieved tranquility and allowed him to endure his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But corruption had already been confirmed in the member, so it could not be stopped, and the corruption spread throughout the limb until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who lanced an abscess of cancer and it became ulcerated near the owner in several days, causing the evil of it to increase greatly.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the cancerous cautery is clean of melancholic humor, so it should not be applied to any part, but rather to a member that is hostile to it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, sons, the art of surgery must be divided into two categories: one is associated with health, and the other with danger in greater preparations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already experienced this in every place of this book where there is an operation in which there is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against this and leave it alone, so that the foolish do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with solicitude and protection from God, and your patients with felicity and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for God's grace to bring salvation and praiseworthy succession, and leave behind the terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and do not abandon your weapons because of that which frightens you; instead, rely on faith in God and in your own name so that examination is not avoided: since remaining with glory, and above all in the world and below your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	In some places, gualia says:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat bad illnesses, so that bad physicians are not recognized".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have now divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and it starts with the first chapter of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is dedicated to the treatment of feet, covering the types of instruments and ironwork for cautery, as well as what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter is about dryness and perforation, air pockets, sores, and extraction of similar conditions, all cataloged and organized according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, treatment of twists and similar conditions; this chapter is organized from the head to the feet, and concerning the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cauterizing with fire and sharp medicine, and recalling the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary to explain the quality of the remedies for that cauterizing and the harmful effects of it, as well as in what circumstances cauterizing should be prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I will explain the quality of the remedy for cauterizing and the harmful effects of it in a long and detailed manner, subtle with knowledge, veiled secrets; many wise men have spoken much about it, but they disagree with each other, and it suffices me to discuss one of their speeches, fearing lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I will explain that cauterizing, in general terms, applies to all materials or its materials, with the exception of two cases, which are cases without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the dry and hard material case, there is disagreement; some say that cauterizing is beneficial in this case, but others say the opposite, that cauterizing is not appropriate for a disease that is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inappropriate for a dry and hard disease to be treated with something that is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says otherwise argues that cauterizing is beneficial for all dry and hard diseases in the human body, because when you compare the human body and its humidity to the nature of fire, the body of a man burns.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I will explain through experience that I have tried in some cases.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not necessary for me to come back to what has been proven and practiced in the chapter on cauterizing due to previous experience, and to know the diversity of human complexion and the placement of diseases within their bodies, as well as the causes of these diseases, and their symptoms, and the space of time for these conditions.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other cases, there is no reason to fear, and even less in wet and moist diseases, because all doctors have already agreed on them, and they are not disputed about the remedy for cauterizing in these conditions.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my sons, that the secret of healing by cauterizing with fire and the goodness of it is due to cauterization with burning medicine, because fire is simple, whose action does not extend beyond the member being cauterized, but affects only the adjacent members minimally with a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of burning medicine extends to adjacent members and strong heat brings disease in difficult-to-heal and weak places.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	However, fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do anything except waste resources, and it is already known through experience and long years of study in the art concerning the truth of causes; because of that, I am excused for the length of my speech. And if it were not forbidden in my book in this place to reveal secret veiled fire knowledge, as well as the quality of the operation in the body and the expulsion of diseases by this method, demonstrated philosophically, which could be useful in your pain.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, my sons, that they disagree on the time when it is appropriate to perform cauterizing and they pause the best time in spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterizing is appropriate in all times, because the harmful effects of time are submerged in the benefit of cauterizing, and even more so if cauterizing is for pain or necessary pain, strong fistulas, which cannot tolerate delay because there is fear of worsening, which is greater than a small harm caused by the passage of time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not to be found in your pains, or my sons, what they estimate is only the vulgar people and foolish doctors, since that disease which is cured by cauterizing is not always beneficial, and they wait for the consequences of it.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they imagine for that reason, because cauterizing is only in a place where medicine alters the complexion and dries out the humidity that is the cause of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cauterizing is unnecessary in relation to medicine due to the desire for its value and virtue and the greatness of its master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the disease may return at some time in the future depending on the patient's complexion and the location of his disease, as well as the virtue of it, and what is prepared in his body due to the accumulation of superfluous substances in him, and what reaches it through diets and similar causes; but the disease in which cauterizing is administered should be a subtle disease with few superfluidities and humidity, such as cauterization of teeth for pain and similar conditions, it is possible that the pain will not return there, but rather it will be small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	A more common saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is said to be righteous, but I do not think that this is a cure that benefits from medicine or any other reason to use caution.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reasoning behind saying that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not that it is administered as a means of treatment in certain diseases, but rather when those treatments do not work, and at the end of the disease, caution is applied and it does benefit.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Then hereafter let it be known that caution is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the reasoning that I understand from the common sayings and tropes of foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients said that gold cautery is better than iron cautery, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	The ancients said that the place for cautery does not burn, although this is not absolutely true, because I have already proven and verified that it does not do so in some bodies, and cautery with gold is better than with iron as they said; however, when you use fire with gold cautery, it is not declared to you, because it depends on the amount you want according to the gold's rugor (malleability), and it must be prepared to be cooled; and if you adjust it over the fire and some layers are created in the fire due to the artificer's occupation with that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, cautery must be made with iron more gently and gradually to correct the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to the chapters, and I have arranged those of the head within the feet, so that you may easily find what you need from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On the caution of pain in the head due to coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization relieves both coldness and moisture in the underlying cause of which there are two, causing headache, nasal congestion, flow of mucus from the ears and aurelhas (eye ducts), excessive sleeping, tooth pain and goulayro (probably a type of neuralgia), and generally any disease that comes from coldness, such as paralysis, soda (sciatica) and apoplexy, and similar diseases in those maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, you command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, according to the severity of the disease, the age and custom of the patient.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And you also command him to shave his head with a razor, and then have him sit on a tilted bench and place your hands over his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And you place the palm of your hand near the patient's nose, between their eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, since the patient's nose is not reached directly, you sign that place with a pen, and then heat the olive oil cautery, which has this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And you place it there on the designated spot, in a manner that it descends, so that your hand may be constrained little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And you lift your hand slightly and look at the spot, and if you see that a certain amount of bone of the head is exposed, such as the amount of grains of sand, then raise your hand, and if not, return your hand with another one, if it is cold, until it is seen the bone that I told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And you take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And you place it on the burned area, over the wound, and leave it until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And you heal the spot with a strong four-ingredient medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they already said that when the wound remains open, it burns more, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that the coccyx should be cauterized until it reaches the bone, and the cautery should be kept there until a certain part of the cavity of the bone is scorched.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And you remove what is close to the bone, and heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They also said that with the cautery, it reaches the end, until the bone is strongly threatened, until the bone breaks, and this is the form of alphecati (a disease or condition):
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that from that spot the vapors of the head will expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	The wound should be kept open for a long time, and it should be healed until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I do not see these two types of cauterization for everything, only in some men out of fear; and you, from me, it is better for health when it is; because the head is exposed due to the solution of continuity of such things as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a weak nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first specialized cautionery is safer and better for me, and from that house and with that work comes safety. (Or alternatively: The primary type of cautery is the safest and best for me; and from that house and with that procedure comes safety.)
Capitol segon.	Secondly:
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head's cautery.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	If chronic and long-lasting pain occurs in the entire head of a patient and it persists despite using tools such as lances, hooks, capsules, plasters, guaze, cudgels, and bandages, among others, and if it has already been cauterized with one cautery without any improvement for that cause, then consider whether the patient's head is of a strong constitution in nature; and if it is not frail and weak, use another cautery to a small extent.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Cauterize that area on the corner of his head with a cautery that separates the skin.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skin and expose the amount that has been cauterized, then cauterize that area again in the lower back of the head at the location known as the "basin" (and this is the location where a blister forms).
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And leave your hand in that place, and do not expose the bone because the patient experiences a great deal of pain different from the pain caused by other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	Label this cautery in its place, because it is more subtle than the cautery used to cauterize the corners and occiput of the head, and this is how it should be done.
Capitol ters.	Seventhly:
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On modern migration treatments.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a sudden pain in the head occurs, or pain inside the skull spreads, it should be treated with medications that alleviate pain, and other treatment, which I have mentioned in the guidelines for diseases; and if all this does not help, cauterization is performed in two ways: either cauterization with a hot burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Heat up the alum in a pot, excavate it and expose both ends of the pot.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the location of the pain on the temple with a sharp lance that is deep enough to expose the bone but not visible from outside.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then apply pressure on the wound using bandages for constant compression, and leave it for three hours; then remove the alum, let the wound heal for two or three days, and apply a dressing soaked in oil until the area becomes dry.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of it until it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medications which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medications.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron can be done as follows: fire for cauterizing, which is described as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	And it is called a nail-like claw because its head is shaped like a nail with some curvature and the middle part of it is prominent.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Place your hand over the painful area (so as not to harm the archery that is already there) and rotate the small iron slowly but surely.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the amount of tissue that is burned by the incision is too large and causes bleeding, raise your hand to avoid injuring the artery already present, so as not to cause bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And soak the area in saltwater and place it on the location, leaving it for three days; then apply a dressing with oil, and take care of it until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize the end of the cutler's hand according to the method of cauterization, and be careful not to make an incision in the artery during this modern technique.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On ancient cauterization of migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an emigranea, as I have said in the previous treatment and its divisions of diseases, and the cure is not helpful, and sometimes because of the disease that does not respond to what has been said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, then it is necessary for you to ignite the cautery knife before it becomes white-hot, indicating the location of pain along a line of length which should be the size of the finger or whatever; and pause your hand for a moment, then strongly press that area and incise the arch and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	You must guard against the continuation of the mandible, which is malfunctioning and should be for chewing, and that the ligament not be swollen and the nerves which control it, and that there is no spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution for bleeding from an artery that has been cut open, because in the cutting of it there is fear, especially in those who do not know what to do and are not trained, let the operation be delayed at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will come to the reminder of the regulation for bleeding an artery accident according to its method, in this book's section on that matter.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if the disease does not respond to this cautery and you see that the patient's body can tolerate it, cauterize that part of the head in the proper place as we have said, and cure the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	If you come, administer the cautery that we have said in the chapter on the compression of an artery with two cauteries, and this is the better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain occurs in the ear due to cold and is treated with cooling agents and other cures as mentioned in the division, but the pain persists, then ignite the cautery, called puntum, which has the following form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And place the puntum near the burning area and extend it around the entire ear as if a wheel is rolled, or in the circumference of each example if the pain is in one location.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move along the ear with the cautery point by point, as you test the area for the pain spot.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you make points with the cautery around the entire ear, and that does not help, then cure the spots until they heal.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of burns.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	A burn that has been treated and then cauterized is not a burn of the kinds that come from poison, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterizing the type of burn caused by dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of burn with herbs and poultices, and your cure is not effective, then it is necessary for you to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first should be the razit of the aurelha, the second a small one at its temple, and the third the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Pause your cautery on the side of the diseased area, because softening is not seen in the diseased area but only in the healthy area.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is to cauterize the area with a cautery at the end of the ear above a small amount on the tip of the head, and at the temple another, the length of which should be equal to the length of the finger, and pause your hand with the cautery until the burned area has been covered by the thickness of the skin layer.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, which is the shape of a knife, the shape of which is flat.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But it is necessary that this one be very thin, as you will see; and it is necessary to sharpen the knife in excessively rough places a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And cure the area with what is before processing until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it with what has been said and your medicine does not help and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize that person with four cauteries: first on all the corners of his head; second at the middle part of the head, as we have said; third in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of using the cautery is as previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	It has been cauterized over the stomach opening, and it is more urgent; and it should be treated with what is processed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization of forgetfulness caused by poison.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give the patient herbs and pills that help to cleanse.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And shave the head of the patient completely and pause at the neck with the plaster described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Pause that area for a while, as this is the method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do what the previous step has stated.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so if it cures well through those means; otherwise, make three cauterizations in the lower part of his head, which are descending from the most superior part of the head down to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place a thick bandage on each cauterization, and apply care to the cauterization with water that is boiled.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If the patient is able to tolerate water, make a cauterization in the proper place; if you wish for more intense heat, then cauterize it on both corns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Apply care to it until it is healed; and the cauterizations should be olive-shaped according to the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On cauterization for relief and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Since you are treating the head with herbs and water as mentioned earlier; then shave the patient's head, and cauterize it at the proper location on the head, and over all the corners of the head, and over the lower part of the neck, and three cauterizations over the spinal processes of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary for softening of the body in severe illness and the patient is tolerant, then cauterize it with four cauterizations on the spine, and afterwards with cauterization until the pain subsides, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Apply care to it until it is healed, and this should be olive-shaped cauterization.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Epilepsy is not cauterized unless it is due to a fever.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so it is necessary to treat the brain of the patient at the beginning with warm and cold treatments, as well as other care that has been mentioned in the previous division when the patient is severe and tolerates the exception of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	If the patient is a child who does not tolerate medications, administer gargles and mouthwashes that are meant to soothe the stomach, for several days, with good nutrition.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head, and cauterize it at the proper location on the head according to the method previously described, and another cauterization on the back of the neck, and one on each corner of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize that area with a heated iron, having paralysis and softening of the body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Then heat the iron as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause the subtle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are rotten and corrupted humors that are thick and weak, then cauterize it with the iron as described earlier to cause paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess declining into melancholy, and the patient's body is moist, then give him water that purifies his brain as previously described in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, and apply a well-made and properly made turban over the circle of the skull, and lay it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	The patient should be seated and held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a poultice; it is suitable for use against ancient scabies of sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat it gradually over the fire so that it suffers no harm when placed in the affected area.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then apply it to the middle of the patient's head in the circle and let it soak until it becomes softened.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Make the patient do this every week once, with other good treatment until he is well; or if you wish, cauterize it by making small points as much as possible, without having a hand always with such an arranged iron: this is a type of cautery that keeps the brain moist.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply it to the affected area in a remedy or liniment made from quinine.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization of water flowing in the foot.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have recognized the beginning of water in the foot through the signs I have described in the division, then begin and give the patient water that purifies his head, keeping it away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	Make him sweat in a bath with alum for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Tell him to wash his head and then cauterize it in the middle of the head with an iron; also cauterize it with two irons over both temples if the moisture is starting to appear in two feet, or one iron if the moisture is appearing in one foot.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise all veins and arteries that are closed, with the iron in the length between the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Keep yourself from bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see bleeding, stop it with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with knowledge regarding the extraction of arteries and the opening of abscesses, as well as taking care to avoid bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Sometimes it is cauterized in the cerebellum between two bones with two irons produced in a certain way.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears in the feet are old, and it is verified that they are a surplus of hot humors, then cauterize it with the iron mentioned earlier for the beginning of moisture in the feet, at the middle of the head and two irons over both temples, and two irons between two bones in the cerebellum.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if addition is needed, then cauterize it along the entire length of the calf of the foot at the end of the eyebrow with a small iron.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterization of nose smell (foul breath).\]    Quan fetor de nas es causat per las humiditats corruptas e mal olientes, lahoras cauteriza aquel am le cauteri que he ditz en le capitol qu'eu te ho ditz de melencolia.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the patient with what I have told you in the division and it does not improve, then you prepare yourself and give him cochineal to drink for three nights; then shave his head, and cauterize him with a medium-sized iron heated on oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Cauterize it with a clove iron and two irons over both eyebrows, close to the hairline.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And take care not to cut through the artery during cauterization.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	The shape of the clove iron is as follows:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the softening of eyelids using a cautery (treatment).
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of an eye is softened due to disease or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, (the healer), cauterize that one on both eyebrows with a small or double cautery all around the temples and extend past the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand holding the cautery, but according to how much of the eyelid is burned.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On cauterizing the eyelid of an eye when the hair turns into parts inside and the eye swells.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of an eye turns into parts inside and swells, cauterize them in two ways: either by burning or with a medicine-burning method.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If by burning cauterization, command the patient to wash their hair as they would when grooming; continue this until the hair grows back and disappears. If it inflames, then you must burn the eyelashes, placing a bandage over them so that no moisture enters until the hair grows out again.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when the hair grows back and disappears, place a bandage on the patient's head near the eyelid of their eye and apply a sign with tweezers according to the shape of a holly leaf, starting from where the eyelashes are growing.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And place cotton soaked in alum or egg white on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Place fire under the cautery, which has this shape:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Place the cautery on the shape you marked, little by little, in observed patches, until the surface of the cystic area, which is similar to holly leaves, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of healing in this work is that you observe the eyelid of an eye becoming contracted and the eyelashes lifted due to the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore, lift it with your hand for three days and place a cotton dressing over it until the scar rises up.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Cure that one with warm liquid until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	However, if the eyelashes return for some reason and the eyelid becomes soft again, then do another cauterization on it as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	However, if the eyelashes are in the eyelid, cauterize it until it returns to its original position, heals, and the eyelashes do not irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The cautery method using medicine burns is when you command the patient to wash their hair until it grows back and disappears; then make a paper with cloth in the shape of a holly leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take known sage and live coal and place them on top. (It seems there is a mistake or incomplete line here, as no text appears to follow this symbol.) Or if you do not know what to do, mix those substances together and make it quickly so that it does not cool down; expand it over the paper made in the shape of a holly leaf, and place it on one or both eyes; then place cotton soaked in alum over the affected eye, and keep the patient's head near you.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the medicine on the affected area and gently press it, but do not let the patient feel the burning sensation of the medicine; for a sensation like fire is painful.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore, when you perceive that the burn sensation has stopped, remove the medicine and apply a cool substance to it; then wash the eye with water; and consider whether the eyelid is raised as it should be after washing with heat or incision, for in this case there will be no more inflammation. If the eyelash returns to its previous state due to the medicine, place the medicine back on the affected area where there was no pressure applied, and do not let it degrade until your procedure is complete and the eye has healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And place pressure on the area to be cauterized until the abscess is eradicated, and care for it with gauze or something else until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And be sure to monitor the wound diligently so that no pus from the abscess flows out, and if the eyelid becomes soft after several days due to the skin's cause in the wound, then apply your medicine on that spot which has become softened, and perform this treatment again, and rotate the medicine around until it heals.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the shape of the myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that men's wounds differ in size and extent, and therefore treat your treatment accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not hide the path of rectitude from him who is devoted to this craft.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterizing a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When treating a fistula as mentioned in the divisions of diseases and not conferring with another physician, you must then cauterize it according to this method: tell the patient to place their head in your lap and have someone hold the patient's head from yours, so that it is neither harmed nor shaken by the patient's head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then apply a piece of cotton wool or beeswax on the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then place the hot cautery with this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is convex, like the shape of a reed or quill, with one end where the cautery is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And insert it into the other end (the concave side).
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	If you wish, try it out. (implied: perform the procedure)
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the convex side is better for the job.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Press the fistula if it is open, and draw out the pus and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not already opened, then open it and remove the stone from there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the hot cautery over it and hold it with a small distance from the patient's nose to prevent your hand or the patient being disturbed, and then press the cautery on the wound and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery enters the bone at first application, that is good; but if not, repeat the cautery once or twice, as needed; and leave it like that for three days, and then press on the area with a linen cloth soaked in drying agent until healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if it has not healed within ten days, then press on it with sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and shaved as necessary in its respective chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another method for cauterizing a fistula is to say: press on the location of the fistula and open it and in that opening place a thin rod of the same form as follows: It was the size of one inch of melted lead; hold your hand over it with good grip, and be careful not to harm the patient because the melted lead should not reach the patient's wound; you must press on the patient's wound with an egg white or water, because lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through miraculous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with the method I have mentioned for cauterizing and healing, that is good; but if not, it is necessary to administer nose drops and reduce the fistula to the depth of the nose as it comes in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On cauterizing a wound on the head.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Frequently wounds occur in the lips, especially in children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if your treatment for those wounds is not effective as I have mentioned in the previous sections, then use a small hot cautery knife shaped like this:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	The concavity should be the same as that of the knife, i.e., shallow.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place it carefully in those wounds until the cautery reaches the bottom of the wound.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On cauterizing a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms on the uvula or palate or between the teeth and becomes pus, make an incision and it bursts, and if it is old, break it open, and burn the abscess and make a fistula, and treat it as I have previously mentioned. If treatment is not effective, you must cauterize with the amount received in the fistula, hold the heated iron in the fistula opening, and repeat this process once or twice; then treat it with the ointment I have mentioned until healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the abscess is drained and heals, that is good; but if not, it is necessary to expose the location and burn the rotten bone according to its respective chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On cauterizing teeth and softening gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are bad, but treatment with medicines is ineffective, place the patient's head on your lap, hold the cautery rod in the shape described below (see illustration), place the handle of the cautery rod on the tooth and insert the heated cautery into the gum quickly so that you hold it there until the heat from the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Lift your hand, and repeat the cauterizing process as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, then spit it out, as the bad tooth is closed and the softened gum is strengthened, and the moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On cauterizing tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness, or it is inflamed or worm-ridden, and treatment with medicine is not effective, you can cauterize it using two methods: either cauterizing with a cattle brand or cauterizing with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a pointed tip should be taken, which is made of cow's horn and iron handle, then take care to wrap it in linen and cover the tip of the cautery, immerse it in hot water, and place it on the painful tooth hastily until it becomes numb.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then repeat this process several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse linen or cloth in the aforementioned cautery and place it on the painful tooth, then place the heated iron on top of it until the iron reaches the root of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire may be harmful if there is an ulcer or abscess in the area and the heat of the fire does not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then hold the heated cautery in the form you choose, place it on the tooth and keep your hand on it until the cauterization is numb; do this several times as needed for the pain to subside or on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And note that for the aforementioned cauterization, the patient must keep their mouth open with good force and hold the cautery for an hour, then spit it out; this is the method of using the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much affected area as you are able to reach.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the shape of the needle (or cannula):
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of hernias.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are of the phlegmatic type and are not obedient to medications for digestion, if you want to promote digestion of that type, then heat the cautery with this shape (as follows): having two handles extended so that smoke comes out from the other end, hold the cautery by the handle and heat it with fire, then place it on the abscess once, and if necessary, repeat until the abscess is cauterized to the root.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	If the abscess is small, then place the cautery on it according to its size, and leave it for three days and place it on top of linen soaked in oil until what the fire has burned away is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And care for it with rinsing, dressings, and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the needle or cautery should be as follows: (No translation needed for this line since it appears to be describing an image or diagram rather than text.)
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of throat ulcers and constriction of veins.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes upon the bronchial tube and especially when it is accompanied by inflammation of the chest, it is necessary to evacuate the patient at first with laxative medicines and then cauterize the root of the larynx in the depressed area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And note that the cautery should not reach the larynx nor burn the cartilage of it, but only a small amount.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	Cauterize that with another cautery at the joint of the neck in the lower vertebrae of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery should be round like a nail, following the previous method (i.e., as described earlier).
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Care for it with what has been prescribed earlier until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.
