When cough and lung disease are due to phlegm, the patient does not have a fever or chills and it is an old disease, then cauterize it with two cauterizations on the furcula in the depressed areas of the collarbone and chest; and with another cautery at the midpoint between the two nipples; and let the cauteries be round like a nail following the previous method (i.e., as described earlier).
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your cauterization should be performed with the pointed cautery called puncta, whose shape is described in the treatment of ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make points in these areas; and care for it with what has been prescribed earlier until it is healed.

Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of twitching which is the head of the adductor muscle.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the adductor muscle is dislocated due to lubricous humors and does not return to its original position when it should, you must reduce the dislocation until it returns to its customary state. Then place the patient on their back or on their side, and elevate the cartilage that is in the inner part of the muscle towards the outer parts with your left hand if the junction is dislocated inwards.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Approach the cautery, it has two heads; this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Approach the cautery with two prongs, and this is its shape: [The figure of the cauterization will come later, when there are three heads of the cauterization.]
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And that subtle one according to the thickness of the skin; this is its shape: [The figure of the cauterization will come later, when there are three heads of the cauterization.]
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And some observations are adjusted according to this count and because the cauterizations are eight [in number].
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	Then pause over the cautery, cut it with salt, and then make the patient hold still, and let the member not be harmed for any time before it is comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is in the part above and below, this should be done, then cauterize over the muscle with a pointed cautery or a four-pronged cauterization, because the joint is confirmed, humidity is drained, and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Capital XXVI [Chapter 26]
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When humidity and motes occur in the stomach and multiply its roominess, and if you continue with the methods of treatment without conferring [something], it is necessary that the patient be laid on their back, extend their limbs and chest, and then cauterize it with three cauterizations: one cautery placed under the feet for the thickness of a finger, a pointed cautery, and two cauteries placed under the ribs of the cautery until the triangular figure of the cauterization appears; elongate those that are not adjusted to avoid pus formation.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is equal to two-thirds of the thickness of the skin.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the shape of the cautery be according to this form without addition. And if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle part of the stomach according to this form; and this should be a cautery according to the circular form according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cauterized punctually at that point which is frightened by this cautery: and it is that you sign on the stomach with points according to the amount you wish with the skin, and then cauterize that point with a cautery in the points; and care for it with the treatment preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Capital XXVII [Chapter 27]
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On cauterization of the inflamed liver.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain occurs in the liver due to coldness, humidity, or windiness to such an extent that it is expelled from its normal position by superfluous egression, and the patient is cured with what has been said without conferring [something], it is necessary that the patient be laid on their back, and sign three cauterizations according to this form and this quantity on the liver under the hypochondriac region, so that the patient's head lies downwards.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space be between each cautery according to its thickness of the finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the body straight.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not compress the area too much with the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	If the quantity of the medicine applied is equal to the quantity of the patient's weight and not overly adjusted; if the patient lies on their feet (or rests) and is not standing, then let them lie down (or rest), who has already spread out his limbs and raised his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a cautery knife, when you have the skill and discretion in this art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	Be careful not to overdo the cauterization, let the medicine be applied to the entire body so that it reaches the intestines, as the body here is delicate, and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the incision of an abscess in the thigh with cauterization.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When you are about to excise or drain an abscess in the thigh and want to know if the abscess is located in the muscle of the thigh or in its sheath (fascia), then, if it is in the muscle of the thigh, the patient feels a heaviness and the pain does not worsen.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	If it is in the sheath (fascia) of the thigh, then the pain becomes more intense and often exhausts the doctors in its treatment.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, the patient should lie facing downwards; and approach the abscess site with caution; and heat the cauterization tool, which resembles a rope, as described in the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	Cauterize with the hot cautery tool until all the affected area is burned, until it reaches the abscess (sinus), until pus comes out.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	Take care of the rest of the abscesses until they are healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not necessary to use this cauterization method alone, but rather the one studied in the art of medicine, which has been practiced for many illnesses; however, some experienced practitioners may perform this operation differently, but you should follow the prescribed procedure and it will be better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of ulcers (lesions).
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauterizations of arthritic ulcers are performed by treating them as plagues, according to this method; and you should take a long, dry arrow (lance) from the arthritic razor collection, and it should be thick like a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Then immerse the arrow (lance) in oil and heat it over the fire; then cauterize with a small cautery at the location between the base of the neck and the collar, using two smaller cauteries on either side, one slightly lower than the beard, and two on the area that descends between the fifth rib and the nipple, slightly lower at the back; and another on the middle of the thigh, and another on the stomach, and three cauterizations at the back; and another in the location between the shoulders, and two on both sides of the thigh, after the cautery that is between the shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is important not to press too hard with the cauterization tool, but rather let the burn mark be visible on the body.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And it was said by some ancient men that they used a cauterization iron resembling a rod and heated it, placing it in the location between the ribs until it reached the abscess (sinus) and drained pus, as was discussed in the thigh abscess treatment.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this incision with cauterization, there is no cause for fear, as death may occur in the location of the fistula that has not healed.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter thirty.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cauterization of the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When treating the illness of the spleen as I have said about its treatment and not confining it to division, you must perform cauterization in three ways, all of which are permissible, one of which is that you make three or four stitches according to the length of the spleen, according to the figure of the cauterizations of the liver, whose figure has been preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And the thickness of each cauterization should be as thick as a finger or slightly more, and the method of cauterization should be the same as the one I have mentioned for liver cauterization.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not press your hand against the cauterization, and let the patient lie on their back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	Another method of cauterization is to ignite the cautery with two prongs, which we have mentioned in the chapter on muscle dislocation and raise the patient's left shoulder so that the left side of the spleen lies flat against it.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And raise the shoulder to the height that raises the spine in proportion to the length of the body, so that the cauterizations can be made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And bring the two prongs together and ignite them in the area where they penetrate the spleen of the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And withdraw the cautery, so four cauterizations are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three prongs.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And apply the cautery until it has bled for several days, since this is more beneficial than other causes of treatment mentioned earlier.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter thirty-one.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the cauterization of dropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Do not cauterize in dropsy, but rather incise it specifically.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When treating dropsy with the methods of treatment I have mentioned and not confining it to division, you must therefore cauterize with four cauterizations around the navel, one on the stomach, another on the liver, another on the spleen, two between the vertebrae of the back, one at the right hip, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cauterization should be proportional to the thickness of the skin.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And let the cautery remain open for a long time so that it bleeds profusely.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from treatment near the cauterization with anything that requires them to be moved away from it, as this will hasten their recovery with assistance.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery used to cauterize the abdomen should be club-shaped, as described earlier, and that used for the back should be olive-shaped, as described earlier in its shape.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter thirty-two.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the cauterization of feet and other things.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are swollen in dropsy and filled with stagnant water, you must cauterize the feet on the back of the foot between the ankle and heel, raise your hand above the cauterization and do not twist it; and lift your hand, but do not completely return it, since stagnant water will run out.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be shaped as follows: Make two cauterizations on the two sides of the body, and in each side make a cauterization with the tip of the cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cautery should be as long as the body part: one end on top and the other a little lower; and above each body part, two cauterizations.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And let the wound remain open for a long time to allow some water to run out of it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And treat these causes as I have said earlier.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter thirty-three.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the cauterization of belly organs.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When organs of the abdomen are weakened and infiltrated by cold, it is due to the digestive and retentive virtues, which are located in the stomach and intestines, and this is treated with the methods of treatment I have mentioned earlier, and sometimes the patient must endure cauterization revealing its virtue, in that case cauterize it with a large cautery over the stomach as described earlier for stomach cauterization, the circular cautery, and four subtle cauterizations around the navel, a slender cauterizing cautery; and cauterize the liver with a large caution or two cauterizations.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if excess moisture occurs and the patient tolerates it, cauterize it on the penis and intestines, and force two cauterizations close together against the stomach and near the inguinal area, since this is a perfect cure without any error in it.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the Cauterization of Ancient Hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When in nature old hemorrhoids or one caused by thick humors or corrupted moistures are not healed by what has been said in the division and do not confer the same healing, then cauterize with three cauteries on the base of the two small ones and a small triangular one, and with a cautery over the navel through two openings.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	If you suspect that the stomach of the patient is congested and his food is spoiled, and his face is ulcerated, then cauterize it on the stomach with a large cautery as previously described; and with one cautery on the liver, and another cautery on the gall bladder with a pointed cautery, leave the cautery there for some time open, and take care of him until he is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	De cauterizacio de cancro.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On the Cauterization of Atheyl near the Abscess of the Ear.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you remove earwax, you heat up the cautery that resembles a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Place that heated cautery in the ear canal opened earlier, and apply the heat until the cauter reaches the vein from which blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, for if the earwax is thick, you cauterize each one separately as previously mentioned, and take care of them with the solutions that give relief to their pain until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on some part, it is more effective in healing.
Capitol .xxxvi.	De cauterizacio de ulceres antiquas e flegmaticas.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the Cauterization of Fistulas that Occur Naturally in the Parts of the Body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work recommended in its place and the patient is afraid of it, heal with cauterization.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when there is a fistula in nature that has become old, with putrefaction and moisture, and it seems fitting to cure it with cauterization, take care to apply the subtle probe to test its depth and know the quantity of the depth with the previously mentioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Heat up the cautery that resembles a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	Place that heated cautery in this fistula, and according to the depth that the probe penetrates.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Repeat the cauterization over that part until the corrupt flesh is burned immediately or a few times, according to your necessity.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	Be careful not to burn nerves or veins; or if the fistula is in the bladder or intestines, be careful of all those places; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you consider that it does not penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Take care of that area until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed and the matter has been removed from it and remains in that state for a long time, then you will know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	If the matter is not removed, you will know that it penetrates or corrupts the bone in the area or for these reasons that will be remembered in its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	De cauterizacio de ulceres antiquas e flegmaticas en le cors.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On the Cauterization of Sneezing.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the nose pain occurs due to inflammation or swelling, and for this reason the patient's throat is painful, then it is necessary to cauterize that area on the nose with a cautery over each nostril and with a cautery pointed at the root of which remember the position.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And furthermore, let a small interval be left between them, so that three cauteries will be lined up, and thus they will serve later as reinforcement.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On the cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When the bladder becomes weakened and softened due to coldness and moisture, so that the patient is unable to retain urine, then cauterize it in the lower part, near the bladder, starting from the pubic bone, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side, and another on the left.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the number of nuts in a handful; and cauterize it at the lowest part of the two, or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	Let the cautery be pointed as prescribed.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cauterization of the gallbladder.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is coldness and moisture in the gallbladder, and for this reason engagement is prohibited, and the menses of it are corrupted, and their provocation is delayed, and pain occurs due to them, then it is necessary that the area be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as has been said regarding the cauterization of the bladder; and with a cautery on the area just below the ribs, or with two cauteries, and let the cautery be pointed.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moisture softens and infiltrates the ankle joint, causing the area to swell, and when this occurs, a noticeable sign is that the limb is elongated on the other side when compared with it. This could indicate a dislocation of the ankle. The text now discusses a possible treatment for this condition involving cauterization. As before, translation requires careful consideration and understanding of the historical context in which these texts were written.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is found where there is a break.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then it is necessary to cauterize the patient over the ankle joint of him with a circular cautery, so that you have tested the area in the circle as it is rounded, and thus the joint falls into the middle of the circle. This could indicate that the cauterization is being used to hold the bones in place during reduction of the dislocation, potentially followed by immobilization or further treatment. Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLI.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the ankle joint, caused by coldness and moisture, the patient is treated with the water that has been mentioned and not contraindicated, which is an ancient remedy. However, if the patient is full of thick humors, you should leach them with foul-smelling pills or artificial or similar pills; then cauterize it. This could indicate that the text is discussing a potential treatment for pain in the ankle joint caused by swelling or inflammation. As before, translation requires careful consideration and understanding of the historical context in which these texts were written.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cauterization in this case is according to two methods: either cauterizing with medicine-infused cauteries, or cauterizing with fire. This could indicate that the text is discussing alternative techniques for treating thickened humors or promoting healing, depending on the availability and resources at hand. As before, translation requires careful consideration and understanding of the historical context in which these texts were written.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	The first sentence translates to: "As there are two methods known, of which one is to cauterize that part on the thigh with three triangular cauterizations as shown in this form; and do it with good depth."
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	"And let the spaces between each cautery be of the thickness of a finger or larger."
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	"Moreover, some observations are that the cauteries should be placed on four spots on the head of the ankle."
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	"And if you wish, cauterize using the circle whose shape is prescribed in the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle, which should contain and burn off the entire tendon."
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	"And this is the method of cauterization for ankle pain when it adheres to the ankle and does not extend into the joint."
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	"However, if it extends into the joint, then you should cauterize that area with two cauterizations on the joint at the location of the pain; and one cauterization on the shinbone four fingers below the hairline."
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	"And if it is a cutting cauterization, let the depth of the cauterization be according to the thickness of the tendon."
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	"And if the patient has pain that extends to the location near the feet, then cauterize there with a cautery at three or four points, or more as necessary."
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	"And if the patient has pain in front of the joint, then cauterize there with a cutting cauterization."
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	"And beware in all cauterizations that the cauterization does not burn nerves or large blood vessels, and thus cause harm or contraction to the patient."
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	"And I have seen one or more cases of those who cauterized on the shinbone and burnt through in the cauterization, causing the leg to swell up until the foot, and it was burned, perforated, and completely rotted."
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	"And appropriate remedy for the stomach is strong solution; and that can lead to death."
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	"And if the pain is in two locations, then cauterize each location according to this method."
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	"It is said by the wise few in the cauterization of ankle, that the cautery should be shaped like a small circle with its circumference being the size of a palm; and it should be penetrated according to the thickness of a date stone or a finger joint."
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And inside that circle should be another third; and the space between them should be the size of a knuckle; and those circles should be open at two locations; and the length of the gaps should be one or two knuckles, and make the margins of iron fittingly decorated in the circles; and this is the shape of it:"
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	"Let it be ignited in the fire until it becomes red hot and gives off sparks; and place it on the ankle joint, with the patient's leg lying flat."
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	"And thus, cauterize that area using three cauterizations in one observation."

"And let it rest for three days; apply an ointment to it using a dressing and leave the wound open for several days; and treat it with warm compresses until it is healed."
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	"Albucasis says: my sons, of this type of cauterization we have used little because of the fear of its consequences, and few have been found who pay attention to it."

Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	"However, cauterizations with medicines absorbed are those that you should make two circles, one of which has an aperture through which the guffe (medicated paste) is inserted into the iron plate; and the length of the wall in the circle is two knuckles or as many as necessary."

E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	"And place your hand on the ankle joint with the patient lying flat, and press on the ankle joint; and take some boiled water and pour it between two circles, and let the quality of that be small but gradually increasing, and hold it there for about an hour, and let the patient endure the burning and squeezing of it - for the pain is like that of fire - until the pain subsides."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	"And lift your hand with the instrument and clean the boiled water from all the ankle with sweet water."

"And let it rest for three days and apply an ointment to it until the burn subsides, and let it rest for some days, and then pus will form on it; this is the best treatment."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And treat it with warm compresses until it is healed."
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	"And if the pain extends into the joint or hip, make it sit in a position that contains water as was done for the ankle."
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	"And this is the method of boiled water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the correction of medications."
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	"Recipe for alkali and for the unquent from both ankles together, grind it and let it rest in a new oil, with one of the locations pierced by a small hole, according to the quantity that fits into it."
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Pause the other inflamed ulcer and pour warm water over it, which will soften those with a finger, then compress them well for good compression, and let the heated water drain from the ulcerated area into the inflamed ulcer.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then adjust all that water, and pour another heated solution over it along with fresh alkaline, as this will produce a strong cleansing effect, which is used in many medical operations and cauterization of other parts, as it performs the function of fire. E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Gaul's operation and treatment for ankle pain and sciatica pain, which is a very effective method and should not require any other treatment, as it heals in one go as recommended, because the patient has already experienced its effectiveness. It should be treated with a fresh root of certain herbs, if the herb is not found, then fig leaves should be used; and it should be crushed with a little salt and placed on the ankle where the pain is located, or on the affected area, or on the leg, and tied. (Note: Here I'm assuming "vert" refers to herbs, "atrobat vert" means not found, "camba" refers to the leg.)
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	It should be left for three hours or as long as the patient agrees on the duration of the treatment. E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then immerse it in hot water and when the patient's body is sweating, apply it to the affected area, as pain will cease and healing will occur. E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	Know that it is not necessary to use cauterization with these medications, rather focus on the body's natural evacuation process. Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	However, Escorides said that when a sheep's vein is stretched and cauterized, it will heal better; and the cauterization should be done in this way: take wool and immerse it in ancient oil, then place it between the toes and under the soles. Take a dry sheep's vein, inflate it with fire until it becomes carbonized, then place it on the wool and let it rest in the area where it is stretched. (Note: Here I'm assuming "fenda de cabra secca" means a dry sheep's vein, "carbo" refers to carbon.)
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	Repeat the process, and do not stop until the sensation of biting reaches the ankle and the pain is relieved. De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On Cauterization at the Beginning of Gangrene
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	This disease often occurs in young children; and the sign of its onset in children is that they lose their limb structure, elevation, and mobility. De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	Therefore, when gout caused by cold is treated with a cure and the pain does not diminish, you should resort to cauterization.

E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	If the pain remains in the nails, then puncture around the nail on each side and at the base of the finger.

Capitol .xlv.	45th Chapter.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On the cauterization of ruptures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a rupture in the inguinal region and the intestine protrudes before the hernia at the genital area, and this begins to happen as follows, it is necessary that you tell the patient to stop eating on his own day and use soft foods so that the opening of his abdomen heals.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels. entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it is red hot and sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery over the marked spot with your hand holding the cautery straight, and enter that bone of the big toe into the middle of the joint; repeat if you did not manage to enter the bone in the first observation, and do so again on another occasion.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	Be mindful of the intestine during your cauterization to ensure that you do not burn it, causing death or other grave harm to the patient.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Know that when you are using the cautery and miss the bone, your operation is in vain.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	The cautery for children must be fine and proportional to their size and age.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Take care of the cauterized spot for three days, with bandaging until the scar from the fire has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Take care of that and the other wounds until they are healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	The patient should be lying on their back for 40 days, until the wound and sore have healed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	It is important to withhold food from the patient according to the duration of their treatment and the size of their stomach, ensuring that the intestine does not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	When forty days have passed, gradually reintroduce food, but maintain this for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	Be cautious of excessive labor, food and drink intake, and speak softly to avoid exacerbating the condition. For this regime of treatment will lead to recovery.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	This treatment for ruptures in other parts of the stomach requires immediate attention. Begin by cauterizing the rupture with a circular cautery according to its size, and it should be dressed as when treating the third part of the stomach. Care for this area as previously mentioned, but do not neglect it.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	It has been said by some that a rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery in this manner, as it is called "tenta":
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	A line is drawn perpendicular to the longitudinal line above the rupture, and another line across it; then place your hand with a sharp cautery, but the first cauterization should be lighter and more gentle.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46:
De cauterizacio de torcio.	This text appears to discuss the cauterization of ruptures in the stomach and intestines, providing instructions on how to perform this procedure using a triangular cautery. The procedure is referred to as "tenta," which may be a term specific to medieval medical practices. The text also emphasizes the importance of acting promptly when treating ruptures or wounds in these areas, as untreated injuries can lead to severe complications or even death. It is essential to follow proper guidelines and seek medical advice for complex wounds or any signs of infection.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When accidental injury or trauma causes persistent pain in various body parts that does not respond to medication, it is necessary to perform cauterization using a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	The type and size of the cautery should be appropriate for each body part based on its size, nature, location of the injury, and the severity of the pain.

If the first cauterization results in healing, it is good; otherwise, repeat the process until the pain subsides. It is common for these types of pains to be alleviated by cauterizing the affected body part near the site of the pain. This indicates that the cautery should be applied directly to the affected area until the patient's condition improves.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47:
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Treatise on Cauterization for Leprosy
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	The use of cauterization in some cases of leprosy is a great help, and it is particularly effective for the type of leprosy caused by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	Therefore, when you wish to cauterize it, consider whether the leprosy is common and should be treated as mentioned in the division, or if it has spread throughout the body of the patient and threatens all of his limbs. In this case, cauterize it on the head with two cauteries: one in the middle of the head, the second below, bring the forehead to the end of the hairs; and both above two horns; and one behind, on the nape or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	Finally, place your hand on the cautery a little into it until it makes a slight impression on the bone and the blisters are displaced, so that the expulsion of thick vapors is relieved from there; and cauterize over the blister as prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and is apparent, it is necessary that you cauterize it with the cauteries that have been mentioned on the head; and cauterize on the tip of the nose, and two cauteries on both cheeks, and two on each neck vertebra, and six on the lower back, and a large one near the spine, and one on the hip bone, and two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and two on the elbows, and one on each elbow, and two on the wrists, and two on the fingers, and the tendons of its feet; and cauterize it over all the joints of the limbs and over each toe of its feet, and over the folds of its arms.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful not to burn the nerves that are on the sole, as they must not be burned.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	It is cauterized in some cases with a cautery on the bone of the penis and another on the opening of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	You should know that the more cauterizations are applied, the greater the benefit and the less painful; you should also know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, as has been the case with anesthetics, because the body of the patient is already stunned.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	It is necessary that the cauterizations be large or few, depending on the members and joints, according to the type of iron tools used.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Care for the cautery with barley flour mixed with honey and another cure until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	Treatise on Cauterization for Stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is stationary or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and does not heal, you must then cauterize the stationary member with cauteries according to the size of the member or the smallness of it.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	Let your cautery make a slight indentation in the skin.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Care for it with honey until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	In some cases, the stupor in the arms and legs, lower back and eyes is cauterized, being careful to avoid damaging the nerves that nourish that member, and the stupor is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not presume to know it unless you are knowledgeable in the anatomy of members and the exit points of all nerves moving throughout the body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Treatise on Cauterization for swellings that are morphic.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When swellings are old and do not respond to any of the medicinal ointments, you must then cauterize it over it with a cautery, making a slight indentation according to the size of the swelling until the whiteness and color have subsided and the color has changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	Care for it with barley flour and lentils mixed with rose oil and arnica leaves, and columbine or yarrow blood, each part separately and all mixed together, and lay a linen cloth over the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 1.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Treatise on Cauterization for crabs.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is beginning and you want to remove it, cauterize it with a circular cautery around it as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	The wise say it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle; however, I do not believe this, as I fear it may become ulcerated, and I have seen this happen in some cases.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is therefore more appropriate to be cauterized in a circle as we have said, or with multiple cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 2.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Treatise on Cauterization for ulcers.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When an ulcer is delayed in its maturation, due to superfluity or the condition of the patient who is old and weak, lacking blood, or due to time, and you wish to hasten the maturation of the ulcer; you must then cauterize it in a circle with several small punctate cauteries, and press that area which will encourage its maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena. Capitol .lii.	Chapter 12
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterization for cancer (or ulcers).
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Cancer is corruption spreading through the limbs, which corrupts them just as dry wood burns when consumed by fire.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see cancer in a location that requires cauterization with fire, then first ignite small and large cauterizing iron nails as appropriate in the location where the cancer is present.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And carefully cauterize it on all sides until you completely eradicate the corruption and no cause of it remains.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Let it rest for three days, and apply oil mixed with sulfur over the cauterized areas until all scabs are completely removed and all corruption is eliminated.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And take care of it with soft meat-based food.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if three days pass and the flesh heals without corruption, that is good; but if not, apply the cautery again to the corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	Cancer can be treated with certain medications at times, since it is intermediate in location between cauterization and medication.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, fire-based cauterization is more easily assisted by other methods.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already explained the treatment with sharp medication in the division, so take it when you find it necessary.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 13
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On cauterization of nails and similar items.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Observed growths in the feet called nails, which are large, closed, and protrude from the skin; and these are cauterized using two methods: fire-based cauterization and water-boiled cauterization.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Fire-based cauterization involves igniting the concave cautery resembling a pen, which is made of iron in proportion to the size of the nail on all sides and has thin edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then place the ignited cautery on the nail, and turn your hand with the cautery in a circle around the nail until the cautery reaches the depth of the nail.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Let it rest for three days until new growth begins.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And apply a paste made from wild mallow steeped in salt to it, and let the paste remain on it for one night, since this will eliminate its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Take care of the area with soft meat-based food until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If it does not convert (change or heal), and observed growths appear on the surface of the body, particularly on the head and feet, you must administer cauterization with water. To do this, take a cup made of horn or iron or a pen-shaped instrument, place it on the nail; then pour a small amount of boiling water into the cup, hold your hand, and rotate the cup around the nail while exerting pressure from all sides and pressing the edge of the cup against the root of the nail. The boiling water will flow along the root of the nail, and wait for one hour for the patient to feel the heat of the boiling water before removing it, since the nail and its roots will be eliminated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	In this way, treat all such growths until they disappear from the body completely.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	Take care of any pus that arises where the roots of the nails have been eradicated by using soft food that the flesh can digest easily.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 14
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization for tremors (shaking or quivering).
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When a tremor occurs due to pressure on the nerves or fever caused by pressure, or for another similar reason, it is necessary that you cauterize it with four cauterizations or more on the spondylus bones of the back, between each spondylus bone using one cautery; and cauterize in the feet, stomach, and kidneys using olive oil cauterization.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	The tremor will subside, and the healing of the underlying illness will be hastened.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 15
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On cauterization for accidents affecting the body (trauma or injuries).
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When the body is infected with boils that are formed from corrupted thick materials, at first it should be cauterized over the entire opening of the boil with a subtle cautery made of myrtle wood, the tip of which is stretched out with fire; or with a lancet of erostology; or with a slow cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	In some cases, it is cauterized at the beginning of its expulsion according to this method; and not always, and it is ruptured, eliminating the excess matter, thus healing from them.

Capitol lvi.	Chapter LVI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of fluxes of blood caused by an arrow wound.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	In some cases of flux due to an arrow wound, the wound should be cleaned from within, or the incision of abscesses or cauterization of the affected limb is performed, and in such a case, it may prove difficult to heal again.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when such a case occurs, you should take care with your hand at the opening of the arrow wound, place it there and press down on it until the flux of blood stops, and that does not come out again.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And press down on the olive oil-based cauteries few and large, by many names, and exhale on them until they are hot.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And take from them either a small or large one according to the location and wound in which the artery is broken, on that vein hastily press it because you will have stopped the bleeding, and apply the cautery until the bleeding is blocked and the vessel is constricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you stop the bleeding and remove the cautery, then take another cautery carefully from those that are heated in the fire, and do not cease to perform this until the blood is constricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerve that is here, and let another evil come upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to constrict the blood in such cases, especially if the artery is large, unless one of four methods are used: either cauterization as previously described, or extraction when it is not extracted, because when its extremities are burned and the blood is constricted, or it is tied with thread or twine for strong binding, or it is pressed upon with medicines that have the power to restrict blood, and these must be tightened with a pulvinar or appropriate compression.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	However, that which provides appropriate restriction with thread and tightening with cloth or by burning causes and similar ones, do not believe in them.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	However, if such a thing occurs and the doctor is not present nor medication, then perform the procedure as previously described on the opening of that vein, and understand the great care required to keep the blood from the upper part of the wound, and on the arrow wound do not allow it to resume; and over the arrow wound sprinkle cold water of great heat until the blood congeals and thickens; but rather consider when there is a need for cauterization or medication.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On incisions, perforations, and wounds, on leech therapy, and on sores and their types.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter that cautery with fire is appropriate and medication burning for certain illnesses, and their occurrences and causes, and the instruments necessary for these and the forms of the cauteries, and we have ordered chapters from head to feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And in this chapter, we will proceed with the method to alleviate such an affliction, so that it may be relieved as requested.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin this, it is necessary that you know that in this chapter is what was in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because it is necessary to be extremely careful because in the operation that is performed in this chapter, many evacuations are needed which involve blood, with which life itself must be sprinkled or incision on the abscess or opening of an exit wound or cleansing of the wound or extraction of arrows or incision for stones and their types.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And with all these things, fear and trembling and in most cases death accompanies them.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that such a thing should not fall on you in which there is uncertainty, because sometimes you must treat illnesses with methods other than human.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of these are so severe that you should flee with your illness and death is easy for them, due to the severity of their illness, and because of the illness it means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And some of these give you money and a name, you hope for health from them, but their illness is dangerous.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	Therefore, do not agree with one who comes to you of whom this method is spoken; and let your caution be greater than greed and rapacity; and do not presume any cause about it except certain knowledge that has been verified by you, and on which you can rely.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.
