If it is not possible to extract it, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the throat of the patient, then place fire in the concavity of the cannula and perform this several times (until the pus dies and comes out of the throat) and keep the patient from drinking water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a sponge filled with water and open the mouth of the patient in that place, rinse their mouth with it; do not let anything pass through that place and mix the water every hour with your hand, as the pus is soon detected by the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	If the recommended method is not forgotten, then fumigate the patient with camphor or asafoetida using the instrument that has been recommended for fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, and it will fall.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Another method of operation in fumigation of that place is to take an oil pot filled with burning charcoal and cover it halfway with a lid so that there is a hole in the middle, and position the end of the instrument in the hole; then hold the fumigation above the patient; and have the patient keep their mouth closed on the end of the cannula, and close their mouth so that the fumigation is not forgotten before you know that the fumigation has reached the pus, as the pus will soon fall out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	If the cat does not come out, you should repeat the subfumigation several times, and keep the patient from drinking, cause them to eat salty and alkaline foods, and not drink water, and it is necessary that this regimen be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the tool with which arterial bleeding from the ulcer is treated when it is visible; and it resembles forceps in some ways, but it has a certain curve.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	The tool should be placed in the ulcer, and its end is similar to a stork's beak, which is covered, sharpened with a file, so that it can compress anything that may obstruct it.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the speech on the opening of ulcers and their section.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Ulcers are special kinds of wounds in various ways, as memory of them recalls, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	They are diverse in the method of their opening and section by two ways, one of which is by the nature of ulcers themselves; and because they obstruct fluids.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	The second method is specifically for the places where accidents of the body occur, because an ulcer that occurs in the head is different from an ulcer that occurs in the buttocks; and an ulcer in a fleshy place is different from an ulcer in a joint; and each of them has its own treatment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	Moreover, some ulcers require that they not be opened except when the wound is matured or completed in them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other ulcers that require opening when they are ripe and not before their completion, such as ulcers near joints, because an ulcer near a joint takes longer to heal until the pus that surrounds it is purged, and it weakens or corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of that member; or an ulcer on a main part, if you delay opening it until it is matured, it can harm the main part; or one in the buttocks, which should not be opened before it matures; and it is not necessary to open a wound that is not ripe except for a wound in the buttocks, because you cannot insert your finger into it and it can elongate towards the parts inside the buttocks, and a fistula is formed or one is made at the edge of it that does not heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Moreover, you must know when to open the ulcer, and this is when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it is ripe when the pain subsides and fever stops, and the decrease in swelling and pulse, and the sharpening of the ulcer head, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you must know that opening should be done in the place most distant from the ulcer and where pus is coming from healing of the edge.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	Opening is sometimes done along the flesh or the body if ulcers are in the groin or feet, and areas of ligaments, tendons, nerves, arteries; and in particular, in all places that do not reflect; because in those that reflect, use opening according to the member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the ulcer is in a fleshy place, it is better to allow confirmation of the digestion of it according to its completion, as we have said; because if you open it beforehand, the wound deepens and becomes more inflamed, and the edges of it are hardened and the depth increased.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	Some ulcers are opened according to the thickness of the flesh or body as necessary, or according to what the member needs.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And it is necessary to administer a small opening, and in large ulcers a large and wide or deep cuts according to the diversity of the size of the ulcers.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	Other ulcers are those in which it is necessary for the edges to be concave and cut when they are opened in such a way that a pouch or abscess has already formed, like an ulcer that occurs in double areas and boils.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised with a section having three corners; and of those is one that is incised like the figure of a myrtle leaf, like ulcers in joints.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of them is one that round and crescent-shaped section are administered, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	However, one that is not like them, such as superficial ulcers of lions, you should open it with a superficial or flat incision only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the ulcer is large and has collected a lot of pus, you should open it and not try to remove all the pus at that time; after removing part of it, leave the ulcer open for another day, and after removing a larger part, make several observations according to gradation until it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	Furthermore, if the patient is a green-eyed man or woman, or a small child, or an old person in decrepitude, because animal spirits are weakened by the release of pus many times, and the patient dies, you should not operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Take great care with this chapter, and make sure your puncture is accurate where you pierce these abscesses, as you must avoid wounding the surrounding area and consider whether the abscess wound is small or flat, in which case you can use a lancet or an ancient method; but if the abscess is large and the fissures of the puncture are many, you must stop every now and then to allow them all to heal simultaneously.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If part of the abscess is detached from the skin or if you have concaved it in its circumference, you must compress it with an old cloth or thread made from linen, as when bread or razors are sterilized, without moisture; and keep it inside for three days; and apply pressure on it and treat it with what is necessary to prevent infection until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If bleeding occurs during your operation, you provide cold water and wine vinegar in which a linen cloth is soaked, and place it over the location of the multiple bleeding spots observed.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the bleeding continues, you must administer treatment and medication as recommended in various locations of this book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is winter and the location of the abscess is near many nerves, you must apply powder in wine and oil of caution, and place it over the affected areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If it is summer and the affected areas are fleshy, you must place powders moistened in water or oil or wine and apply them frequently until the third day, as mentioned earlier, and you should then remove the abscess and prevent it from becoming infected while providing it with appropriate treatment until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	This is what is required for the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses universally, but according to the division I have already mentioned for each type of abscess and the specific methods of their cure in separate chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On incision of abscesses that appear on the skin of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On small abscesses on the skin of the head, and those that contain special types of nodes with tunics made for them; and the various types of their locations.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And some have pimples, and among those are those that contain moisture similar to pus.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And some have moisture resembling flour and similar to them, and among those are those that are hard and lapidary (stony).
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	In the section of all, and in the extraction of those [things], there is no fear, for the extraction of those things does not hinder archery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation in the section of those things is that you use an instrument of the shape which approaches closely to them, called entromes, until you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	But if what it contains is moisture, then you should divide it with a section according to its length by means of a shallow incision in the following manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin at the section of line B up to line G. Then, when the moisture is evacuated, you should excise that part which contains the moisture, and be careful not to leave any cause for it whatsoever, because too much observation returns if there remains some cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And immerse the wound in Egyptian clay if it is present, or, if not, in water and salt; fill the wound with that mixture and leave it until another day, because with this you corrode everything that remains of the skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And repeat the treatment with Egyptian clay several times if necessary, until you are confident that there remains no cause for the skin; then take care of the wound with Egyptian clay until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an abscess contains greasy nodes, you should incise it in this manner:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	The incision should have the shape of a cross, and cut it between two lips of the incision and pull it out from all sides, exerting your strength in the extraction of the sac containing it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	However, if your archery is hindered by this, do what I told you earlier.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And treat an abscess with lancing and care according to what I earlier told you; lancing an abscess is easier because it has less blood and less moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes these abscesses are in the head of some men who have none of it (humidity); this cause is because I lanced an abscess on an old woman's head like hard, rough, white stone, which could not be pierced, and if anyone struck it, they would be injured.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	However, in other abscesses occurring in the head, this is not the subject of this chapter, such as abscesses that occur on the heads of children and which you should lance the auricles, but the incision for these shall be a shallow incision.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the perforation of those from the lower part so that the body will be relieved at the lower incisions.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And take care of them with what is appropriate for their treatment.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses deeply enter the neck and the armpits and the groin, and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck are divided into two: those that originate from within it and all scrofulas of these are distinguished by their own sac, as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we earlier recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofulas are either hard or soft, those that contain moisture being soft, and those that are malignant should not be treated with care.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in the one that you see well-positioned in the Touching, of which the color of what is apparent is similar to that of kelp and is bad throughout, and is not attached to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the archery, and is movable, it is necessary that you incise it with a shallow incision from the upper part of the body to the lower part of the body along the line of G to B, and scrape it from all sides, and cut two lips of the kelp with scissors or with a knife if necessary, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract it bit by bit.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more caution not to incise the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, which may adjust your hand to the incision or upset the patient, and that you incise what is not necessary to incise; because if you incise a vein or artery and forbid yourself from continuing the operation, you should pause in the wound treated with quicklime or other powders that cause bleeding, clean the wound, and leave it until the acidity of the abscess subsides and the wound becomes soft and porous.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is separated (or drained)
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation before it was completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And find out if there are any other small scrofula (abscesses), so that you may incise them and clean them up.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if the large vein is involved in the abscess, cover it so that you do not incise the abscess at its base.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Bind it well with a strong bandage and let it heal within itself without any harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And fill the wound with old lard (or ointment) that you have already applied, and take care of it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the entire abscess, then ensure that you close the two edges of the wound and suture it as soon as possible to prevent any excess leakage.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is an excess leakage due to the large size of the abscess, then understand to incise the base of it, drain it, and provide stitching and treatment for it.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for abscesses containing moisture (pus), make a superficial perforation where the abscess is about to mature and pause the perforation of the pus that rises from the body's base, as we said earlier.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And apply perforation (or lancing), using lard or similar substances to corrode the infected material.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	When you see that the wound is clean, care for it with fresh meat-based ointment until it heals.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII. (43)
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of a gangrenous appendix in the gallbladder (or abscess).
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients performed this incision on the appendix, and I have never seen it done in our land.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their (ancient) discourse.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men with obstruction (of the gallbladder), the removal of the appendix should be avoided, as it does not benefit the patient because all the veins and major vessels are nearby.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have appendixes infected with abscess or gallbladder or double earlobe (gallstones), when the illness is not in the bladder, it is necessary to perform the incision of the appendix to avoid death caused by strangulation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we wish to incise the appendix, we should make the incision three circles from the gallbladder's circles or four with a smaller section along the length between two circles according to size, ensuring that the incision is in the cephac (the body of the gallbladder) and not the cartilage. This location is suitable for incision as it lacks muscle and the veins supplying blood are nearby.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the surgeon is inexperienced, extend the cord of the gallbladder by an inch and make a split in the cord up to the channel, but avoid veins supplying blood if possible.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And make a split in the cipallus (gallbladder) as recommended; this refers to the incision of the channel through the flap that is at its exit and where there is damage or abscess of the bladder.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	Leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	So that the fear of perforation is removed, sew together two edges of the cord of the wound and only stitch it without the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And apply medicines that make the flesh heal.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	Albucasis says that the essence of the recommended discourse is to open the gallbladder of those who have appendixes infected with abscess and the patient has already died, and the intestines are cut, and someone goes to incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe through the wound for some respiration, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, I command that the wound be left open until the malice of the illness is consumed, which takes three days; and once this is done, I command to sew up the wound and care for it until it heals.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen personally is that a woman took a knife and put it in her own gallbladder and incised one part of the lung, and I was called to treat her, and I found the wound infected like the breath of the dying, and I exposed the wound and found that blood was leaking from the small wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that she had not incised a vein or ligature, and the wind came from the wound, and I treated it until it healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the woman did not recur in the bladder if there was no improvement in her condition, and another few days were allowed for her recovery.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the incision of the appendix, there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV (44)
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On the incision of an abscess that occurs in the gallbladder outside, which is called a hernia of the gallbladder.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	The abscess called hernia of the gallbladder is a large abscess according to the color of the body and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	It is according to two methods, whether it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	In the natural case, it is not necessary to treat.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accidental case is according to two methods of which the first is similar to fatty nodes, and the second method is similar to an abscess that is made by the constriction of an artery, and in this case there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	It is not necessary to make a presumption of the patient unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	You should investigate that and observe it with the said method, and if you find something similar to fatty nodes, and not suspended from any vein, then you cut it in a way like nodes, and remove it along with the part that contains the skin and bursa; otherwise, you search for its entire existence and take care of the area with something that is needed for healing until it heals.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter forty-fifth.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the cutting of types of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the many types of nodes, I have already said all their species in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	It is necessary that I explain the difference between a node and an abscess when there is doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that an abscess is heat and fever and violent pain until the ebullition of excess is stopped; and it is a putrid completion which now stops the fever, pain and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a node does not contain heat, nor fever nor pain; it contains that cyst lion which is at the head.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And according to the color of the body, it begins like a pimple and is made in the same way as cheese, whether large or small, and they are of two species, whether fatty and contain moisture, and the colors of moisture are many, as I said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the treatment of a node, you expose it and investigate it at its beginning with an instrument called intromes, according to its form that will come in the chapter that is close to this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	The method of investigation of abscesses and all nodes is that you take this instrument and insert it into the place most moist that you find in the abscess, and you turn your said instrument slowly into it until you know that the instrument has already penetrated the skin.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then you hold your hand as close to the end as the size of the abscess allows, and then remove the instrument and examine what has come out from it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	If the flowing moisture, whatever its color, is forgotten, you cut it with a superficial incision as I have said in other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture from the instrument's probe, you know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	Dry it over the incision using a cross-shaped form like this:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	As you have learned, suspend it on one side and cut the skin all around it with ease, and keep the skin or bag if possible over it and remove the pus from it along with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken during the operation, it is not possible to remove the healthy one, and you watch carefully for it to fill up with pus, and then you remove it in pieces until there remains no cause.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if something remains from it, either a little or too much, the node returns according to its nature.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that something small remains from it, you fill the wound with some sharp and corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and stop it over the abscess cauterized area, and heal the other with another healing until it heals.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, you sew together its two lips and heal it with what embroiders it.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if there is pulsating vein at the opposite side, or not pulsating, you take and fill the place with a three-stranded silk that is vitriol and let it rest for two or three days until the wound heals and stops the bleeding of blood; then return to cut what has been broken from the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter forty-sixth.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of instruments necessary for incision and perforation.

E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	These are the forms of tips, and they are called alberd, and one of them is called berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And of three spices, for it is great, mild, and scarce.

La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of a mild substance, [the form] of this is:

E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And make small, large, or lion-shaped drains with these, similar to large needles that are sewn together, and made of copper, iron, silver, or gold. The best ones are those made of copper.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	These drains are made from black plums, which are known to cause the abscesses in their cavities to burst and reflect back on themselves.

And of three spices, for some are long-lasting, others mild, and others short-lived, according to the size of the fistula and its stricture [narrowness].

Forma de scapel pauc:	Shape of a small scalpel:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The incisions made where there is cutting are sharp, and the other incisions are not sharpened but are performed cautiously so as to avoid injury to a vein or nerve during the excision of nodes (lumps) or abscesses (pus-filled sacs), and for those the patient is healed, and peace of mind is achieved somewhat through the cauterization that is required after the excision of an abscess.

The forms of spatisms, which are hidden among the wounds and require the drainage of abscesses without the patient's perception, and there are three types: large, medium, and small.

Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are forms of lemon juice, round with some length, and they are subtle.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	It is necessary that these types of abscesses (small, medium, and large) be drained of blood flow with speed when needed, and at first, there should not be any medication.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to drain blood in any part of the body, only in fleshy areas, such as the armpits and thighs, and the armpits, breasts, abdomen, groin, and similar fleshy areas of the body, and use humidified cotton for this purpose.

Some times are the forms of these instruments which are small and resemble fish scalers in this way; with which blood is drained when it is done by venipuncture or arterial puncture.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And some times are the forms round in this way:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.

And remove the connective tissue that is between the edges of the wound, and remove the excess fat, and administer what was previously mentioned for suturing and the powders necessary for the healing process until it heals. (Guessing that 'huemplas' means 'fill', 'enguent' means 'clean water', 'corrosiu' means 'corrosive', assuming that the text is discussing what to do when an incision on a breast wound is not completed due to the patient's distress or bleeding)

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49. (Assuming that this is a chapter number, and moving on to the next sentence for translation)
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On incision of abscesses that occur due to archery or veins. (Assuming that 'seccio' means 'incision', guessing that 'arceria' refers to archery, and assuming that the text is discussing a medical procedure related to abscesses caused by injuries sustained during archery)
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When the archery is broken and the bandage that covers it becomes consolidated, then swellings occur and an abscess appears. The signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscess are due to the artery or vein are: for when the abscess is due to the archery, it extends along the front of the body; and if you press the abscess with your fingers, you will feel a grating sound.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is due to the vein is rounded at the chest.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	If the incision on this abscess is erroneous, and particularly in those where the bladder is present, and in the groin, and in the neck, and in various parts of the body; and if it is large, therefore its healing should be avoided, and that which is in the extremities, or at the head, should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	When it is due to inflammation of the opening of the archery, make a long incision in the bandage; and cut open the incision with scissors and approach the archery, and free it from the layers up to where it is exposed.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And place the needle on top of that and make it penetrate into the other side, and firmly press the archery in two places - which causes you to extract two archeries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And press on the area between two ligaments with a lancet and introduce sponge into it until the blood comes out, which will resolve the abscess.

De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the purification of children and the treatment of those who have undergone circumcision.

De extraccio de peyra.	On Stone Extraction
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela. E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	The stone originating in the bladder is the one that lodges in the bladder itself.
