E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The method of drilling or sawing the limb is to tighten one ligament on the side of the part you want to drill, and tighten another ligament on the opposite side; then extend one ligament on the side you want to cut and extend another ligament on the other side; and separate the flesh between the two ligaments using a spatula until all the flesh is exposed; and then make an incision or saw it.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And you must stop all the ligaments at all the parts so as not to touch the affected area, and bring the dressing to the patient with suitable injury and sterile dressing.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs during surgery, you should cauterize the site carefully or place some hemostatic powders to stop the blood; and then return to your treatment when it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cover the affected limb with an appropriate dressing and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I recommend to you what is appropriate for a man in his foot, this event occurs that I also advise, which is when blackening of the skin on the foot occurs due to burns resembling fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	This corruption first appears in the affected toe and then affects the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Therefore, prepare this man by giving him more painkillers and anti-inflammatory drugs as the healing process approaches the affected limb with the intensity of pain and burns increasing, and drill the hole in the joint, and heal it.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Over a long period of time, this persistent corruption appears in the finger tip (of the hand) indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it comes to me, and I am pierced to expel that surplus with water that should rest on the hand of medicines, near the purification of his body; and the surplus is not returned and begins to go into the other said inside before it starts in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he called me to incise (make an incision) on his hand, but I did not want to do so fearing the return of that surplus, and instead I feared the incision of his hand might be fatal because the patient's vitality was weak.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he fainted from me (the doctor), he returned to his land and I was informed that the man prepared and incised his entire hand, and he recovered.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And this narrative has not been added except as an aid for what is known about this disease, and as a signification by which it may be understood and acted upon accordingly.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the care of sinuses and the quality of cleansing with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy member and the space of the abscess is prolonged before collection of pus, it should be broken and perforated, and the pus is drained from there, leaving a hollow cavity resembling a vessel, and the dressing that is placed over it should be thin and not lead to further corruption, nor press on bones or nerves or ligaments. This is called a sinus, and it is not referred to as a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged before corruption sets in any member, it is called a fistula and not used.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of this is to incise the entire dressing in the same manner as it is rolled up, especially when it is made thin and treated like cloth, and make sure it does not adhere to the area due to corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the dressing will adhere and that corruption has not been achieved through subsequent consequences, and if the dressing contains pus on its surface, then you treat it with cleansing.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if it is considered to be a sinus and it is large, and the stench from the arm is strong, then you should cleanse it with an Egyptian remedy that consists of oil, vinegar, and zenna root powder, which are mixed together in a vessel and cooked until they become a pure liquid.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then you take the necessary amount from it (the Egyptian remedy), dissolve it in water and honey; then cleanse the sinus with this liquid, and tighten its opening, and leave the medicine there for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then remove this with care, and continue doing so for several days until the sinus is purified and the smell is gone.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is cleansed with water of ashes when this medicine is not available; and in such a case, you should take the ashes of vinegar and put them in water, then boil that solution and use it to cleanse the sinus until you are confident that the sinus has been drained.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian remedy or water of ashes, then cleanse it with water and honey mixed with zenna root powder, or with vinegar and honey, because honey has properties to purify and clean, while vinegar makes the sinus adhere, especially when there is excess stiffness and dryness in the vinegar.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and are confident that the sinus has been drained, then cleanse it with a solution that makes the flesh grow there.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take defyfinicon oil and dissolve it in rose oil and vinegar, or cleanse it with various remedies and ointments that have properties already mentioned in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	If the orifices of the sinus are narrow and cannot accommodate the canula of the clyster, you should gradually widen it with a small iron, pausing at each point where it is wrapped in Egyptian wool or Basilicon gauze until it is fully widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	If the orifices are wide, you should add the lips to it with stitching and leave the quantity within the clyster unchanged.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	If the orifices of the elbow joint are raised above the parting lines, then you should dry it in the affected area so that the arm can run into it below, because when the arm is bent at the angle of the sinus, flesh will be generated there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	If it is not possible to dry the sinus into the bone as you desire, then pierce the member to prepare it for the procedure by which the arm will pass easily through it according to how it suits you and that there is no obstacle preventing the arm from passing.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take medicinal plasters and place them on the sinus according to what suits your intention of extending those over a cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	The cloth should be of sufficient size to cover the entire sinus; and then, using scissors, make an incision in the straight part of the sinus orifice that is slightly wider than the orifice itself; and then, extend it over another piece of lion wool according to the width of the incision, and place it on top of that at a distance from the sinus orifice to relieve the pain of the arm and not allow the cloth to be too large, but rather cover it slightly for a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	However, the one that is over the sinus orifice should always be kept wet to prevent anything from sticking to the arm there.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know whether what is passing from the arm is more or less, or digested, or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And in this way you observe the location of the sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	When your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter excreted over the sinus orifice has adhered, or adhesion has occurred, then you should detach it or on the third day, when you detach the wound, you change the cloth and renew the dressing.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	However, if from the sinus there is a subtle discharge of fluid, do not despair of adhesion, because healing occurs there, for some men in whom slow generation of flesh in wounds occurs, and of those it is made contrary.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	If the arm is undigested for more than several days from the sinus, then you should know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and its cause is prolonged, then you dry the medications, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they become as dry as diaphonous ointments when excess addition of zizy is applied.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The next remedy that cures is to take diaphonous ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, and have an old remedy in its substance, and mix it with that and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it is similar in this action when there is no arm, diaphonous ointment, honey until it thickens, and use it; or take myrrh and aloe and grind everything into a powder over the honey that is on the fire, and apply that to the sinus with a linen, and strengthen it with the honey that you have heated until it thickens, and grind it again into a powder and apply it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Some days are administered with long aristology and the essence of celestial lily (and this is celestial lily) and the flour of iris and centaury, and use them as simple or compound remedies, grind those and sift and powder over the recommended honey; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the sinus is prolonged and not cured by this treatment, then you should know that the corruption is in its depth, and you begin an investigation into the bones or other hard members or ligaments; then you cure it with fistulous treatment as previously described.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of panaric and fingernail removal, incision, and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panaric is an abscess that comes from the nail of the finger of the hand or foot, and it grows strong in other fingers, and when it is prolonged and its cure is valuable or it becomes an abscessed panaric or corrupted, and it gushes arm into the root of the nail, and it completely corrupts that one, and it carries its corruption to the bone into a foul odor, and the tip of the finger is destroyed, and the color of it is made dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Therefore, when you have what has been said in the division and do not confirm your treatment, then it is necessary that you incise with an iron all the excess that has accumulated from the nail and apply cauterization to the wound near it, because cauterization is beneficial in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	However, if the bone is healthy and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail press the flesh at the sides inside, and it begins to penetrate there, then you should stop the subcutaneous pus at the angle of the nail that penetrates the flesh, and force it up and incise the flesh easily, and pause over what remains of the flesh with corrosive medicines until everything is drained; and apply it with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If corruption has already spread in the bone, it is necessary that you drill the bone and extract it, for no time will heal if the bone is corrupt.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the decay and corruption spreads to the bone, it is necessary that you drill it as soon as its location is remembered, and apply care to that area so that it may heal.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If the finger or toe is subjected to percussion or traction, and pain is intense, it is necessary that you first anesthetize the patient, then cut the nail sharply with a transverse incision across from top to bottom, but not to penetrate into the flesh beyond the nail, for you will cause intense pain to the patient and it may cause excessive growth of the surrounding skin at the location; and apply care to that area with something that relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	That which is said to be "adjusted", that is born in the hands of many men, it is strong in flesh and bone, or it is strong in nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And these are born at the joint or they are the growth of nails from those [joints].
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	That which is born in the nails of the finger is not harmful, but that which is born at the joints is harmful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And from those which are fleshy, the section will be easy and you should drill its root with a large drill.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But from that which is born at the joint's roots, healing is difficult, so take care not to open it up (i.e., do not perform an incision).
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	In that which is born in the finger, it is necessary that you drill the flesh of it at first with a round drill into the bone, then use a suitable saw, and apply care to that area so that it may heal.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Consolidation which occurs in the fingers between its motes (i.e., joints) or due to human birth defect, or due to consolidation of wounds or burns, or for similar reasons, it is necessary that you remove that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Place a pad of fine oil-soaked cloth between their (joints) to prevent them from consolidating easily, and separate them or place a thin layer of lead between them until they are consolidated as necessary.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in the palm of the hand, you should remove that consolidation as it is prepared and suitable for the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of drilling defects, they are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Defects (i.e., vices) are varicose veins, and are large twisted veins full of melancholic bile that occur in the members of the body, and their major manifestation is in the legs, especially in those who travel, work or carry things.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, it is necessary that you administer purgation of the body of black bile several times with strong emesis, and draw blood from the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the treatment of their (varicose veins) with iron is done in two ways: one is that it is drilled and the black blood is drawn out, and the other way is that the vein is raised and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning of it (varicose vein) is done in this way: first, the leg is wrapped with warm water up to when the thick blood is resolved, which is a dark substance from the vein, and then the patient's leg is strapped above the knee to the most prominent part of the calf down to the ankle with a bandage, and then the vein is cut in one or two or three places, but make a wide incision, and raise the black blood with the iron rod from below the vein upwards and downwards until the desired amount and what you want to remove has been removed, and this will relieve the pain of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And tie it up (the bandage), and order him to abstain from foods that cause black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by anesthetizing (the patient) when the veins are full and you notice this in the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The elevation of them (varicose veins) is done in this way: you should shave the patient's leg if it has sores and then immerse the leg in warm water and wrap it with hot water up to when it becomes swollen and the veins become prominent; or exercise it forcefully, if bathing is not available, until the member becomes warm.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the cord along the vein in a long or short section depending on whether it is on the right side of the vein (i.e., medial or lateral), or at the bottom of it you should use the heel.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the cord with scissors and peel off the vein from all sides until it is felt, and it should be noticed that it becomes darker and more painful.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And therefore, when you notice the white cord that is the vein.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then place a roll of linen beneath it (the vein) until it is raised and detached from the cord, and suspend it with iron wire.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section on the same side for three fingers' width, and peel off the cord above the vein up to where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift and incise that [area] in the rear section, you must cut the heel, then extract that and raise it to the second section, and extract that from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Then extract that from the section above it (the highest or most superior one) until it is completely outside; then incise that.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	If it does not bulge out, insert a strong double-pointed needle and tie it off, then extract it, or pierce it with the lance and turn your hand all around until it is pierced through.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Be careful not to incise it; for if it is broken, it will make it difficult to raise the hernia and may cause harm to the patient because of that.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Once that is completely removed, place your hand on the location of the wound, which has been soaked in wool dipped in vinegar and both roasted and unroasted oil, and cure it until it heals.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	If the wound is contracted and has tortuosity with an enclosure at the partitions, and it is not according to what has been said, then you must cut along the entire length of the tortuosity and at the locations of the enclosures, and suspend it with stitches until it rises completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Be careful not to incise the vein or injure it, for it will be difficult to raise the hernia if you do so; and use your discretion in that matter.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the incision made to the broken vessel:
Forma de unci orp:	The form of a stitch (orp):
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It should not be done in this way as with the stitches or of an acute point so that it does not injure the vein; and it should have a thick, flexible lion's head shape, for if it were too fine, it would cut the vein due to its thinness; having an excessive thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of the vein in the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the hips in lands located in the south, such as Al-Andalus in Arabic lands and in the southern and arid lands of India with little fertility where there is neither herb nor tree.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is also generated in other parts of the body, other than the hips.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is of putrefaction that comes from the intestines, such as venom inside the body coming from snakes and worms breeding between the intestines and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	The sign of the onset of this condition is a swelling of that vein which occurs in the hip, and when the area is inflamed, the vein begins to flow from the location of that swelling, as if it were growing like a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	When the limb appears, then you must cover it with a lead weight of about two drachms and bind it tightly to keep the lead suspended from the bed.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as often as this occurs outside, cover it with lead and leave it hanging.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	If the pain persists, you must make an incision on it and cover the remaining part; do not incise more than is necessary for it to come out, because if you incise too much, it becomes constricted, enters the flesh, causes abscesses, pus and ulcers in the area.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it must be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely expelled from the body without leaving any trace in the intestines.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some men have been born who are as long in length as five palms and more than ten, and it has been reported to me that one was twenty palms long.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	If it is incised during the time of treatment, insert the iron into the wound and perforate it with a long iron rod with the body until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the location for some days with medicines; and cure it by treating abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	This vein sometimes causes ramps, and more so when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and causes numerous abscesses, from each of which ramifications grow.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	Therefore, cure it as has been said in the division and with what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	From the incision on worms generated under the skin and called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called bovine disease in some lands because it often invades cattle and is a small worm that is born between the intestines and flesh, which grows throughout the body, rising and falling, and is eventually expelled through the bowels.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to the putrefaction of some humors such as worms, snakes, larvae and tapeworms in the abdomen.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared due to its malice, for when it moves through the body and reaches the head, it causes a strong stench and enters the nose and destroys the brain, and this happens many times.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Therefore, when you want to cure it and extract it, you must not do so unless its movement and appearance are felt by the senses; and therefore, you must strengthen what is on top of it and what is below it and apply strong pressure, and then press down on it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	If it is tied in the flesh and does not burst, you must stop the cauterization with fire on the location until it dies, and the main cause that is feared is corruption of it, which corrupts the location as has been said before.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If you see it reaching the head near the nose, strengthen and apply strong pressure on the forehead, press down on it and extract it; and the patient must use body cleansing with medicines that evacuate putrid humors and avoid foods that generate putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	From the incision on the disease of the liver (jaundice).
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called jaundice in our land, and it is pain that occurs in some members, and it is bound from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen this as I recommended to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You were summoned to a sick woman at a village, and you found her arm exposed and saw a small inflammation on the vein of her arm, and although it had been opened for an hour, I saw that inflammation spreading as if worms were crawling towards this place, but more slowly than expected, as if silver was flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then, pain occurred in that area and settled into the muscle, and wait here for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then return to the other side of the body until you reach the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	Then I instructed him to rotate the body all around as I observed; and he was very surprised by the change in position and the swiftness of one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And he had seen similar things in the most severe cases according to that method, but I have observed more of those that change pain from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not observe it as much in the cases of women.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not consider it to be only due to the woman being old, as the body and veins were exposed in such cases, and this manifested as a breathlessness that was changing.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not recur in those who are pleasing and have moist bodies with weak veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And as you wish the cure of it and the patient feels pain, do not approach the inflamed area as I have said, rather strengthen yourself on it and let it be slightly moist and cold over that area until that constriction is released, and cauterize the spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it in your cases, then cure it by evacuating the body and expelling any breathlessness, and give him fumigations made with foul-smelling herbs and pills of serape and similar ones.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of extracting sage.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sage is diverse according to the species and according to the places in the body where it grows, since its variety is that some have large points, small, concave, mute, are solid; and of those with three angles, and of those to which there are tongues; and of those to which are spikes.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the pain in which it grows is according to two methods: because the members or principal ones cause it, such as the brain, the heart, and the liver, and the lungs, the kidneys, the intestines, the bladder, and similar ones; and when it appears in any of these members and you notice signs of death, I recommend that you return to prevent it, because it is necessary to avoid extracting that sage in those cases where death occurs quickly in the one in which it is most serious, and when you do not see such bad signs, and the sage is not concealed in the depth of the member, then you take it out and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the symptoms of serpents is when you find sage, pierce the bone and it emerges from the cavity that is above the brain, which happens due to violent soda, blindness, dizziness, hotness in the body, inflammation and burning of the tongue, spasms and confusion of understanding and vomiting of bile, and the speech becomes faint and destroyed, and the voice is lost, and there comes out from the wound site white moisture similar to dust, and eyes like watery flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	Therefore, if these symptoms appear to you, then avoid the cure and the extraction of the sage unless necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the sage that grow in the heart, which is near the left nipple, are as if it were embedded in a hard cause, and not empty; and strong movement of the sage resembles the movement of the thumb, and bleeding from the wound is black, and there is loss of heat at the extremities, sweating, and fainting; therefore, know that death is imminent.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	The symptoms when the spear has pricked the lung specifically with bloody foam from the wound, and the vessels near the neck are applied, and the patient's color is changed, and they exhale a great spirit and ask for air in distress.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the spear pierces the covering which is in the foot, and pain occurs near the small bones of the ribs, and it causes great and intense pain with heavy sighing, and he is not able to move all his limbs due to muscle pain.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the spear pierces the stomach, immediately there will be a foul smell coming from the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the spear pierces the abdomen and is lodged there, a tear or hole appears in the wound, or the intestine or hernia that was torn apart cannot be removed, and there is no hope for healing from the extraction of the spear.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the spear pierces the bladder and is expelled outside along with urine, and it causes infection outside, and strong pain occurs in the patient, then you know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	However, other members such as the head, neck, throat, neck, gullet, shoulders, and their similar parts of the limbs, such as the spine, collarbone, pelvis, hip, waist, and their counterparts, are saved provided that the spear does not hit a vein or artery and is not poisonous.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recommend that you be aware of these spears since they can indicate the nature of the wound for healing purposes.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that in a man a spear enters the tear duct of his eye at the root of the nose, and I extract it from the other side, leaving the hair of the eyebrow undamaged, and it heals without causing harm to the eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another spear from a Jew who it had entered in him at the root of his eye, leaving the eyelid intact, and the spear was already hidden and could not be found except for a small tip adhering to its shaft, and it was a sharp spear of Turkish origin with a lion's head without hair.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew is unharmed, and there is no adverse effect on his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another spear from a Christian who it had been shot in the neck, and it was an Arabic spear with feathers; and then I cut into it between two guide-lines, and it was submerged in his neck; and then I softened it with that, and placed my hand over it, and the Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another spear from a man who it had been shot in the stomach, and I thought he would die because of that; but since thirty days had passed without any change in his condition due to his actions, I cut into the spear and carefully removed it, and he recovered without any further injury.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man who had been shot in the back, and the wound had healed over, but after six years, I extracted the spear at its source.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman who had been shot in the stomach, and the wound had healed inside her, and there was no change in her condition despite taking medication, and the woman suffered no harm from any of her natural activities.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man who had been shot in the face and the wound healed, but when I removed the spear, there was no further pain, and similar symptoms occurred.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the spear from the man of the king who it had been shot in the middle of his nose and had started to protrude slightly on the right side and was completely hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him three days after the wounding by the spear.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I examined the wound of the spear, which was not very deep; and I tested it with a fine probe, but did not feel anything; but I felt a prick under the right eyebrow, and therefore suspected that the prick was from the tip of the spear.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I spread the area with a plaster containing astringent and digestive properties, assuming that the area was covered so that it would appear to me the location of the spear, so that I could cut into it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And there was no adverse effect in the area that indicated that the spear had reached that location; and I continued with the plaster over it for several days without any further injury; and the wound healed in the meantime, and the patient recovered from the extraction of it within a few days until one day he felt the spear inside his nose and reported this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I covered the wound with a strong corrosive medicine for several days until it opened, and with the probe, I felt its tip, and I removed the tip of the spear gently from the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Approach the wound in the opening of the injury with that sharp medicine as soon as the tip of the arrow becomes visible to my eyes, and pass some time with it for up to four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	When the wound is swollen, make it possible for forceps to enter it and secure them in place without moving. Then do not stop refining and inventing means to treat it until a day comes with suitable forceps to remove it; and when this has been done, restore the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Some doctors thought that the nose cartilage had not been restored, and you restored it and the wound healed, and the patient was cured by complete health, and never suffered in any way from it again.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	I recommend to you the quality of extracting some arrows for which you will have to follow this rule and significance on what I have not said, because the parts of this art and the definitions of that one are not understood through narrative or by reading these books.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	The wise craftsman compares a little with much; and what is present on what is absent; and he must use new operations and new instruments to deal with the strange causes of the art when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	Therefore, I say that arrows are not lost from the limbs in which they are inserted except by two means: either through attraction to the place in which they were inserted; or through the opposite side of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And the one that was shot into the place where it entered or was an arrow made of flesh and was shot and lost.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	If you do not move at the moment when it is shot, then you must leave it for several days until the flesh around it has healed and the attraction and its exit have been alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if it is inserted in the bone and you do not move, then leave it for several days and turn it with attraction and movement every day, and it will be lost.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	If you do not move for some days, then you must perforate the surrounding tissue of the arrow around that bone with a fine instrument to enlarge the area around it, and then remove it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	If the arrow is inserted in the bone of the skull and has passed through one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the patient with some of those accidents that I have mentioned, then refrain from removing the arrow and leave it until the patient's condition stabilizes for several days; because if the arrow reaches the cistern, death is not prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is not inserted into the bone but only enters the body and does not reach the cistern, and the patient remains for several days without any of those accidents occurring, then you invent a means of attracting the arrow and the area around it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is not moved and you do not remove it, then administer several treatments around the arrow as recommended, and take care of the area until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow has been hidden in the body and is not felt, then you must search for it with examination, and if you feel it, then shoot it out with suitable instruments appropriate for attracting it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	If you cannot move it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the probe, and it is not a bone or nerve or vein here, then make an incision over the wound until it can be enlarged enough to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	If there are any wounds around it that must be kept, then you must cut the flesh in which it is inserted on all sides with all the skill at your disposal; and invent something, if you cannot move it due to the evasion of the flesh in the breakage of the auricles and twisting of those until it becomes necessary.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the removal of the arrow in any location where it is, you must use twisting with your hand and forceps on all sides until it becomes obedient; and refine it with the greatest subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and is removed with great difficulty due to its attraction and extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	If you cannot operate at that time, leave it for several days until the swellings around it can subside, and then repeat the process when it has been alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If the flow of blood opposes your treatment, administer what was said in its section for cure.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Watch over the virtue of incision in vein or nerve, or cord, and administer every possible means to avoid the escape of pus; perform it with ease, calm, delay, and firmness as I and you recommend.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore, compress the abscess to make the patient conform to the figure in which you must lance the abscess; it is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not possible for you, administer what is possible according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But abscesses that are located opposite another part, or which cause one part to spread over the other parts, or cause swelling in the outer part of the abscess by sensation of the part above the cavity and sometimes protruding; in this case you should incise it; and make the incision according to the size at which the forceps grasp it; and tie it, as it is easily cut off.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, you must twist the lancet contrary to its direction until the abscess enters the bone, and widen it, then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	If not, leave it for several days, then repeat the process until it bursts open.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the fistula of the abscess is in that area, you must push it with something.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the fistula is cut and you wish to administer pressure, introduce your finger into it, if it is closed, use a spoon concave on the inside so that it enters the concavity of the fistula and press it with something.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the abscess is concave, you must press it with a strong spoon inserted into it, as the abscess is relieved by this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	If the abscess is surrounded by hard tissue, you must cut away all the flesh in which it is located, if possible, and treat it with what is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the abscess occurs on the foot, belly, bladder, chest, or side and is close enough that you can touch it with your finger, and if it is possible to incise over it, do so, be careful not to cut a vein or nerve, extract it, and sew up the wound if necessary, and treat it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Make forceps for lancing abscesses:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	The tips of them are made like a bird's beak that is made with a saw when they grasp the abscess so it does not slip.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And from these are made different sizes: large, few, and medium-sized forceps, according to the size of the abscess and its contents, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Make a spoon-shaped instrument with this concave tip like the beak of a bird, to relieve the obstruction in the abscess and push out the closed one:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Make an instrument for pushing out a closed one:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Like a rod to relieve the obstruction in the concave abscess and push it with that one.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On venesection (phlebotomy).
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins to be cut for phlebotomy, it is customary to make a cut of 30. in the head, there are 16 veins to be cut for phlebotomy. There are two pulsating veins that are near the ears, called auricular veins; there are two herbs that are in the two temples; and there are two veins that are in the two tear ducts of the eyes, called lacrimal veins; and the vein located at the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is at the tip of the nose; and two veins that are at the neck; and two veins that are on the upper lip; and two veins that are on the lower lip; and these are the veins that are called "angular" (I assume it's a typo for "anterior"); and there are two veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are cut in the arms are 5. Because one of those is a cephalic vein, and it is necessary to let the wild goose fly; the people call it "the vein of the head", and it is a minor vein, and it is made up of one branch of the basilica and another branch of the cephalic vein; and the people call it "the vein of the whole body", and the basilica is the vein that is paused at the domestic artery, and it is called "cephalic," and the vulgar people call it "the abdominal vein"; the biceps brachii, and it is located above the elbow, and it is the one that is cut, and it appears on the outside; the cephalic, and it is the vein between the previously mentioned one and the next one, and it has two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and thigh there are three veins: one of those is called the great saphenous vein, which is located at the bend of the large toe; the second is the small saphenous, and its location is the back of the thigh of the large toe; the third is the sciatic vein, and its location is the back of the thigh of the large toe; and in the thigh there are other veins similar to these.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The support for the veins that are near the ears is useful for treating ancient catarrhs, migraines, and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	The quality of bleeding those veins is as I recommend to you: it should be shaved the patient's head, and the patient's head should be wiped in the occipital area at the locations of both veins with a large, clean cloth; press the patient's neck with one hand using a bandage that shows the locations of their ears in two places pressed on the sides of the patient's head; and try that method, and if you feel the pulse of those veins with your finger, here is the test.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the surgical lancet, which is pointed, and insert it into the vein in the cavity to the bone where the blood flows out.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then lift your hand with the vein and cavity to the incisions above, and cut the vein with a pointed instrument.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the incision should be two fingers' width or approximately that amount, and let the blood flow out as much as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And press the pulse and leave it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And at the beginning of this book, the incision and cauterization of those have been described.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But of the two arterial veins at the temples, the benefit of bleeding is for migraines, old and chronic ailments of the eyes, and acute corpus disorders in the head.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	The quality of bleeding those veins is as I recommend to you: constrain the patient's neck so that both veins are felt with clear perception, and show the pulse of their pulses with your finger; then you will know if the test is successful.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then lift the cavity over the vein at the incisions indicated by your finger, insert the lancet with a pointed tip below, and lift the vein upwards; cut it in this way as you did with the other veins; and let the blood flow out according to your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And unbind the patient's swelling, place your finger over the vein for an hour, and press on that spot and hold it firmly, then leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And the reminder of them, as well as their incision and attraction, has been given at the beginning of this book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore, the benefit of bleeding the vein on the forehead is similar to bleeding the occipital vein for ancient facial diseases, migraines, and putrid ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	The quality of bleeding that is as I recommend to you: the patient should hold their neck with a bandage until the vein appears, and take the instrument called the cautery, which has this shape:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Press the pointed end of the instrument at the top of the fossory vein and strike it with a blow or in another manner, and let the blood flow out according to the amount you wish; then unbind the perforation of the patient and hold it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	Sometimes bleeding is opened with the cautery, but it should not be done with a very sharp point as in other bleedings; instead, it should be from a broad point, and bleed it transversely because the bone is close and strong, and the bone may easily break when the cautery is fine.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the benefit of the two veins that are at the tear ducts of both eyes for eyelid inflammation due to redness and swelling in the eyes, and facial diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	The quality of the bleeding is that the patient holds their neck with a bandage, and you bleed them, standing over their head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	Make the bleeding transverse in width less than one finger at the tip because there is not much tissue in that location; and if the bleeding is fine, its tip is easily broken.
